news.title: Zvigananda Push VP Chiwenga Out
news.content:
By A Correspondent  President Emmerson Mnangagwas loyalists, infamously known in Zanu PF circles asZvigananda a cabal of corrupt bootlickers and power brokers  have successfully pushed Vice President Constantino Chiwenga out of the partys succession race.

Led by Justice Minister Ziyambi Ziyambi, the Mnangagwa-aligned faction used the just-ended Zanu PF Annual Peoples Conference in Mutare to cement the presidents continued rule beyond his constitutional mandate, which ends in 2028. Their collective push for what they dubbed the ED2030 Agenda marked a decisive moment  one that buried Chiwengas long-nurtured presidential ambitions.

The Mutare conference endorsed a controversial resolution to extend Mnangagwas rule until at least 2030, a move that tightens his grip on power and sidelines his deputy. In doing so, Zanu PF has effectively shut the door on succession discussions  at least for now.

Government spokesperson Nick Mangwana confirmed the resolutions on X (formerly Twitter), stating:

Main Highlights of the 22nd ZANU PF National Peoples Conference Resolutions: In recognition of the extensive development achieved under the leadership of His Excellency, President Mnangagwa, his term of office be extended from 20282030. Party and Government are urged to do the needful to ensure all constitutional legalities are in place before next years conference.

Mangwana added that both the Zanu PF War Veterans League and the Womens League backed the proposal, praising Mnangagwas visionary leadership and calling for the formalization of the term extension.

Political observers say the development underscores Mnangagwas success in neutralizing his deputys succession bid, rekindling memories of the alleged gentlemans agreement made after the 2017 coup that ousted Robert Mugabe. Chiwenga, who led that military operation, was reportedly promised the presidency after Mnangagwas first term  a promise that now seems irretrievably broken.

Since taking office, Mnangagwa has systematically consolidated his power  restructuring key state and party institutions, promoting loyalists, and sidelining top military figures perceived to be aligned with Chiwenga. His dominance over the politburo and provincial structures has left the former army commander increasingly isolated.

Analysts say the Mutare conference resolutions represent a strategic knockout.

Mnangagwa has used the party machinery to crush Chiwengas ambitions while portraying himself as indispensable to Zanu PFs survival, said a Harare-based political analyst.

By the time the conference ended on Saturday, it was clear: MnangagwasZviganandafaction had once again outmaneuvered its rivals  pushing Chiwenga further to the margins of power and cementing Mnangagwas dominance in Zanu PFs succession narrative.
news.description:
By A Correspondent — President Emmerson Mnangagwa’s loyalists, infamously known in Zanu PF circles as Zvigananda— a cabal of corrupt bootlickers …

news.title: Mutsvangwa’s Statements Of Disrespect Against VP
news.content:
The Head of State of ZimbabweCde ED Mnangagwa

18 October 2025

Dear Honourable President

RE: Utterances by Chris Mutsvangwa towards VP Chiwenga

I am writing to bring to your attention a matter of grave concern regarding recent utterances made by Chris Mutsvangwa that denigrate Vice President Constantino Chiwengas career in the military. His statement claiming he would have been a better General than Chiwenga has the potential to cause dispondency among military personnel.

As you are aware, General Chiwenga commanded the army since its inception and rose to the rank of General before retiring. As the commander in Chief who appointed Chiwenga to be Vice President Mutsvangwas comments are an affront to your judgment.

Moreover, Mutsvangwas statements disrespect the current generals and the Zimbabwe Defence Forces as a whole, given that they all served under Chiwengas administration. His lack of regard for the rank and file of the defence forces is evident.

Notably, during Chiwengas tenure as Commander of the Defence Forces, significant milestones were achieved such as the attestation of the first group of female cadets in the army.

I strongly appeal to your esteemed office to consider requiring Mutsvangwa to withdraw his statements and face reprimand. Given his track record of being recalled from various government positions, including ambassador, minister, and presidential advisor, its questionable whether he can claim to be better than Chiwenga.

Yours Faithfully

Cde Bvanzu Bvanzu

Concerned Citizen
news.description:
The Head of State of ZimbabweCde ED Mnangagwa 18 October 2025 Dear Honourable President RE: Utterances by Chris Mutsvangwa towards …

news.title: Zanu PF Defying the People’s 2013 Constitution
news.content:
By Engineer Jacob Kudzayi Mutisi-Once again, Zimbabwe finds itself stuck between a rock and a hard place, where political power seems to overshadow the will of the people. The ruling Zanu PF party appears to be defying the National 2013 Constitution  the very document that Zimbabweans overwhelmingly voted for in the hope of building a democratic, transparent, and accountable nation.

What we are witnessing today mirrors what happened during the early years of independence. When Robert Mugabe was Prime Minister, he pushed through constitutional changes that transformed his office into the presidency, consolidating power and setting a precedent that has haunted our politics ever since. Today, Zanu PF seems to be walking down that same dangerous path  manipulating the law to serve political interests rather than the peoples will.

During his 22nd conference address, Vice President Constantino Chiwenga made an emotional appeal about the need for integrity in leadership. He said,We must always remember that we are not the Alpha and Omega of Zimbabwes journey.These are powerful words that should resonate across all political ranks  but they must also be backed by action. The same Constitution that Chiwenga speaks of so eloquently must be protected, not violated.

The 2013 Constitution was a hard-won victory  a product of national dialogue, citizen participation, and a collective desire to prevent the excesses of the past. It represents the peoples voice. Yet, recent legislative amendments and political manoeuvres raise serious concerns about whether Zanu PF still respects that social contract.

Chiwenga also reminded the nation thatthe fallen are watching us.Indeed, the liberation heroes who sacrificed their lives did not fight for a country where a few individuals could twist the Constitution for personal gain. They fought for a Zimbabwe where law and order, fairness, and justice would prevail.

A local political analyst put it plainly when he said,The bond between the party and the people must remain unbroken. Citizens are becoming increasingly aware of their rights, and they will not stand idly by.His words reflect a growing national sentiment  Zimbabweans are awake and watching. They are tired of seeing their Constitution treated as a political tool rather than the supreme law of the land.

We have seen this story before. In the 2000s, constitutional amendments were used to extend power and crush dissent. The same cycle of constitutional defiance now threatens to undo the progress made over the past decade. As a nation, we cannot afford to return to that dark chapter.

Zimbabwe now faces a defining moment. The leadership must choose between upholding the peoples Constitution or repeating the mistakes of the past. Our democracy depends on this choice.

The Constitution is not a Zanu PF document  it is a peoples document. It must be defended, respected, and lived by all who swear to serve under it. The struggle for true liberation continues, not through war or slogans, but through the defence of the rule of law.

Engineer Jacob Kudzayi MutisiWhatsApp: +263 772 278 161

By Engineer Jacob Kudzayi Mutisi-Once again, Zimbabwe finds itself stuck between a rock and a hard place, where political power …

news.title: VP Chiwenga Loses ED2030 Agenda Fight
news.content:
By A Correspondent  Vice President Constantino Chiwenga has suffered a major political defeat after Zanu PFs annual peoples conference in Mutare endorsed the extension of President Emmerson Mnangagwas rule beyond 2028  a move that effectively buries Chiwengas hopes of succeeding his boss.

The resolutions, collectively dubbed the ED2030 Agenda, signal a decisive consolidation of Mnangagwas grip on power and a major setback for Chiwengas long-held presidential ambitions. By backing constitutional changes to allow Mnangagwa to remain in power until at least 2030, Zanu PFs leadership has sent a clear message that the presidents succession is off the table  for now.

Government spokesperson Nick Mangwana confirmed the resolutions on X (formerly Twitter), writing:

Main Highlights of the 22nd ZANU PF National Peoples Conference Resolutions: In recognition of the extensive development achieved under the leadership of His Excellency, President Mnangagwa, his term of office be extended from 20282030. Party and Government are urged to do the needful to ensure all constitutional legalities are in place before next years conference.

Mangwana added that both the Zanu PF War Veterans League and the Womens League supported the proposal, hailing Mnangagwas visionary leadership and urging the party to formalize the term extension.

Political observers say the move underscores Mnangagwas success in neutralizing his deputys succession bid, reigniting memories of the unfulfilled gentlemans agreement allegedly made after the 2017 coup that ousted Robert Mugabe. Chiwenga, who led the military operation that propelled Mnangagwa to power, was believed to have been promised the presidency after Mnangagwas first term  a promise that now appears all but broken.

Since assuming office, Mnangagwa has systematically consolidated his power by reshaping key state and party structures, promoting loyalists, and pushing out or reassigning top military figures perceived to be aligned with Chiwenga. His control over the Zanu PF politburo and provincial leadership has also tightened, leaving Chiwenga politically isolated despite his military background.

Analysts say the Mutare conference resolutions mark the clearest indication yet that Mnangagwa intends to rule beyond his constitutional limit. This is a strategic knockout, a Harare-based political commentator observed. Mnangagwa has used the party machinery to crush Chiwengas ambitions while portraying himself as indispensable to Zanu PFs survival.

The conference, which ended on Saturday, effectively threw Chiwenga under the bus  confirming that Mnangagwas faction remains firmly in charge of the partys future and succession narrative.

By A Correspondent — Vice President Constantino Chiwenga has suffered a major political defeat after Zanu PF’s annual people’s conference …

Continue reading "VP Chiwenga Loses ED2030 Agenda Fight"

news.title: Mnangagwa Thrashes VP Chiwenga
news.content:
By A Correspondent  President Emmerson Mnangagwa has once again outmaneuvered his deputy, Constantino Chiwenga, after the ruling Zanu PFs annual peoples conference in Mutare endorsed a proposal to extend Mnangagwas rule beyond 2028.

The development, seen as a major political blow to Chiwengas long-held presidential ambitions, effectively cements Mnangagwas dominance within the ruling party. The Mutare conference resolutions signal that the presidents allies are determined to push for constitutional changes to allow him to remain in power until at least 2030.

Government spokesperson Nick Mangwana confirmed the resolutions on X (formerly Twitter), writing:

Main Highlights of the 22nd ZANU PF National Peoples Conference Resolutions: In recognition of the extensive development achieved under the leadership of His Excellency, President Mnangagwa, his term of office be extended from 20282030. Party and Government are urged to do the needful to ensure all constitutional legalities are in place before next years conference.

Mangwana further noted that the Zanu PF War Veterans League and the Womens League both resolved to extend Mnangagwas term, praising his visionary leadership and calling for measures to formalize the extension.

Political analysts say the move exposes the widening gulf between Mnangagwa and his deputy, who has been quietly positioning himself to take over since the 2017 military coup that brought Mnangagwa to power.

Chiwenga, the former army general who led Operation Restore Legacy, was widely believed to have struck a gentlemans agreement with Mnangagwa that he would serve one term before handing over power. However, Mnangagwa has since consolidated control over the party and state institutions, systematically sidelining his ambitious deputy and his military allies.

Over the past few years, Mnangagwa has replaced or reassigned several senior military figures aligned with Chiwenga, strengthened his grip over the Zanu PF politburo, and courted key war veterans and provincial leaders to secure loyalty ahead of any future succession battles.

The Mutare conference resolutions, observers note, mark the clearest sign yet that Mnangagwa intends to extend his rule  despite growing discontent within sections of the military and the party who view Chiwenga as the legitimate heir to the presidency.

This is a strategic knockout, said a Harare-based political analyst. Mnangagwa has used the party machinery to neutralize Chiwengas ambitions while projecting himself as indispensable to Zanu PFs survival.

The conference, which ended Saturday, effectively threw Chiwenga under the bus  confirming that Mnangagwas faction remains firmly in charge of Zanu PFs political future.
news.description:
By A Correspondent — President Emmerson Mnangagwa has once again outmaneuvered his deputy, Constantino Chiwenga, after the ruling Zanu PF’s …

Continue reading "Mnangagwa Thrashes VP Chiwenga"

news.title: Chiwenga Sends Stern Warning To Malcontents Betraying Values Of The Liberation Struggle
news.content:
By A Correspondent

Vice President Constantino Chiwenga delivered a fiery address at the ZANU PF Annual National Peoples Conference in Mutare on Friday, warning against corruption, betrayal, and moral decay within the ruling party.

It is my profound honor and privilege to stand before you today to introduce the guest of honour, His Excellency the President of the Republic of Zimbabwe and First Secretary of ZANU PF, Chiwenga began. This is not merely another conference. It is a moment of reflection, renewal, and recommitment to the timeless values that have carried our revolutionary party from the liberation struggle to the future we envision.

He said holding the conference in Manicaland was deeply symbolic, as the province played a historic role in the liberation struggle. It was a crucial gateway through which thousands of brave sons and daughters crossed into Mozambique to wage the struggle for our independence, he said.

Chiwenga paid tribute to the freedom fighters who sacrificed their lives for Zimbabwes independence. Through these mountains behind us, they slipped across the border  young, determined, and full of conviction  to bases such as Chimoio, Nyadzonya, and Tembwe in Mozambique. Many died in the bush and under aerial bombardment, not in battle but in hope, believing that their sacrifices would purchase a just, dignified, and prosperous Zimbabwe for all, he said.

He described the liberation camps in Mozambique and Zambia as altars of sacrifice, places where pain, courage, and faith fused into the spirit of liberation.

The cries of those who fell still echo across these hills, he added. Their blood speaks from the soil, reminding us that our freedom was not inherited  it was earned through suffering and consecrated by unwavering conviction.

In a direct warning to those he described as betraying the legacy of the struggle, Chiwenga said, Their voices cry out against greed, corruption, laziness, and moral decay. The liberation struggle was a collective mission in which the people  the youth, the women, and the workers  played a decisive role. That bond between the party and the people must remain unbroken.

He urged unity and discipline within ZANU PF, saying, The same unity and singleness of purpose that drove our liberation struggle must now be the moral compass guiding us into the future. We must continue to move forward as one party, one people, one destiny  bound by a shared vision.

Turning to the conference theme,Attainment of Vision 2030 Through Economic Empowerment and Value Addition,Chiwenga emphasized that economic progress must be inclusive. The central task before us is to build a people-centered economy that empowers every Zimbabwean and ensures that our national wealth benefits all, not just a few, he declared. Economic empowerment must be genuine  equipping our people with the means to produce, innovate, and own their destiny. That is the essence of Vision 2030 and the essence of revolutionary continuity.

He also invoked the sacrifices of liberation heroes like the late General Josiah Magama Tongogara. Some of them knew they would not see a free Zimbabwe, Chiwenga said. They fought for the future, not for themselves.

Concluding his address, Chiwenga called for recommitment to the partys founding principles. ZANU PF stands where it is today because it has traveled a long, demanding journey of vision, unity, sacrifice, love, and singleness of purpose, he said before inviting President Emmerson Mnangagwa to the podium. Pamberi neZANU PF! Pamberi naPresident Comrade Emmerson Mnangagwa! Pasi nemhandu!

Chiwengas speech came amid mounting tension between him and President Mnangagwa over the succession battle, as reports continue to suggest that Mnangagwa seeks to extend his term of office beyond constitutional limits.
news.description:
By A Correspondent Vice President Constantino Chiwenga delivered a fiery address at the ZANU PF Annual National People’s Conference in …

news.title: Watch: Mnangagwa Loyalists Sing 2030 Ndeya Emmerson Despite Worsening Social Unrest
news.content:
By A Correspondent

ZANU PF loyalists broke into a new campaign-style song titled 2030 Ndeya Emmerson during party activities in Mutare on Friday, in what observers say is a coordinated effort to drum up support for President Emmerson Mnangagwas continued rule beyond his current term.

ZANU PF online activist C.H. Mukungunugwa proudly announced the development on X (formerly Twitter) on Friday morning, writing:

2030 Ndeya Emmerson is the new hit song! Vamhu vavharisa Mutare. Im telling you, Mnangagwa is loved, my brothers and sisters  Ive never seen anything like this since 1980!

He added that the atmosphere in Mutare was electric, with party members chanting, dancing, and singing in praise of the 81-year-old leader. Mazizi vachiti Tonho Zvinoo, he exclaimed, celebrating what he called an unprecedented show of unity.

Mukungunugwa further claimed that the chants reflected a peoples resolution for Mnangagwa to stay in power until 2030.

Because the people have spoken! From all 10 provinces, grassroots to national level, members have gathered in Mutare to support Resolution Number 1: President ED Mnangagwa should continue leading until 2030. This is the peoples call, not the Presidents  a true reflection of the nations will and unity, he wrote.

However, the singing and public displays of loyalty come amid growing reports of a widening rift between Mnangagwa and his deputy, Constantino Chiwenga. Analysts say the 2030 chants are part of a factional campaign to sideline Chiwenga and legitimize Mnangagwas bid to extend his stay in office beyond the constitutional limit.

The spectacle in Mutare, critics argue, signals the beginning of an intensified internal power struggle within ZANU PF as the succession debate heats up.

Thunderous ArrivalBecause the people have spoken!  From all 10 provinces grassroots to national level  members have gathered in Mutare to support Resolution Number 1: President ED Mnangagwa should continue leading until 2030. This is the peoples call, not the Presidents apic.twitter.com/e5ZShe0ih4

2030 Ndeya Emmerson Is the New Hit song Vamhu  Vavharisa Mutare. Ndati Mnangagwa Unodiwa Hama Dzangu Handisati Ndamboona Zvakadai KUBVA 1980Mazizi vachiti Tonho Zvinoo @CrimeWatchZW@ali_naka@LynneStactia@KMutisi@MacBeltspic.twitter.com/AZaQthRLrA
